home.subclaim: Zocurelia supports reading together, especially when your community is spread all over the world, your school, your university or your city.

motivation-idea.headline: Motivation and Idea
motivation-idea.zotero: Zotero is great for collecting and distributing Open Access literature and Open Educational Resources in a reading community. But as Zotero reading lists and collections do not provide a back channel, you usually need additional tools to track and share comments, annotations and discussions.
motivation-idea.hypothesis: Here, Hypothesis comes in handy. All online media in your reading list can be annotated and discussed among community members with this smart browser tool.
motivation-idea.zocurelia: But how do you and your community track this activity on your reading list? Enter Zocurelia!

features.headline: Zocurelia Features
features.subline: Zocurelia is short for Zotero curated reading lists annotated. It integrates the features of Zotero and Hypothesis seamlessly. With a Zocurelia list you can show the Hypothesis activity for each text on a Zotero reading list.

collect.headline: Collect
collect.description: Choose texts for your community and structure them in Zotero collections. Invite others to add to the list.

curate.headline: Curate
curate.description: Add a curation note with Markdown in Zotero. Tell your community the reasons why a text was chosen.

tag.headline: Tag
tag.description: Allow your community to classify texts in Zotero with tags and thus help each other to adjust their learning curve.

annotate.headline: Annotate
annotate.description: Link from Zotero to Open Access versions of articles and books. Use Hypothesis to annotate and discuss while reading.

share.headline: Share
share.description: Invite other to participate in your reading community and share a link to the Zocurelia list within your class or in social media.

track.headline: Track and React
track.description: Curious what others think about the texts you are reading? Track what's going on in your reading community and react.

hypothesis.dashboardlink: Open Hypothesis dashboard for latest annotations.

help.introduction: Zocurelia facilitates reading in distributed communities. This section will help you getting started.

readers.headline: Zocurelia for Readers
readers.introduction:
Using Zocurelia for reading together is easy. All you need is a Hypothesis account, a curated Zotero reading list and the address of an according Zocurelia community page.
To give you an example:
readers.hypothesis: This is the link to register a Hypothesis account or log into Hypothesis.
readers.zotero: This is an example of a publicly accessible Zotero reading list.
readers.zocurelia: This is the Zocurelia community page that combines Zotero and Hypothesis in an integrated view.
readers.videointroduction: If you have all this set up, watch the following video. It shows how to interact with the Zocurelia community page.
